titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. Records
titlestmt.author: Alison Clemens

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoded in EAD by Archon 3.21 from an SQL database source on September 14th, 2016.

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. Records 1993/2002

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. Records

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: This collection documents the creative process of Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. as it produced album artwork for Houston-area and other American hip hop artists.

bioghist.head: Historical Note:
bioghist.p: Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. was founded in September 1992 by brothers Shawn and Aaron Brauch in Houston, TX. The Brauch brothers got their start in the music business by working for Rap-A-Lot Records in Houston before recognizing that demand for their graphic design work was high enough for them to start their own company.

Pen & Pixel was innovative in its wide use of Photoshop to create CD covers filled with layers of special effects, highly stylized lettering, and plenty of “bling” (flashy jewelry, expensive clothes, luxury cars, and piles of cash). The company became associated mainly with rap and hip hop musicians in the 1990s, working with renowned artists such as Master P and Lil Wayne and record labels such as No Limit Records and Cash Money Records.
In addition to CD covers, Pen & Pixel also produced artwork for posters, logos, and videos.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Photocopy decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. Records. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics or Technical Requirements:
phystech.p: Some digital files can be viewed in the UH Digital Library at http://digital.lib.uh.edu/collection/pixel. Digital archival materials can also be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. Materials not in the Digital Library may require up to one week to access. Contact curator Julie Grob (jgrob@uh.edu) for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection documents the creative process of Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. as it produced album artwork for Houston-area and other American hip hop artists. The collection contains 67 digital files, 13 posters, 9 poster flats, and other material documenting the company, including a catalog and photographs of its staff. It also includes a Geto Boys storyboard, made under the auspices of Rap-a-Lot Records, and two t-shirts.

did.unittitle: Digital Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some digital files can be viewed immediately in the UH Digital Library at http://digital.lib.uh.edu/collection/pixel. Digital archival materials can also be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. These materials may require up to one week to access. Contact curator Julie Grob (jgrob@uh.edu) for more information.

did.unittitle: Digital Promotional Artwork

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Digital Promotional Artwork series includes 40 digital files of artwork for CDs, vinyl records, videocassettes, and other promotional material produced by Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. The intended format for the promotional material files is indicated as part of the title for each item, but artwork was often reworked into various formats. For example, artwork created for a CD cover was often adapted for use in a poster. All but two of the digital files (Cher and Chris Rock) can be viewed immediately in the UH Digital Library at http://digital.lib.uh.edu/collection/pixel. The digital files can also be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. They may require up to one week to access. Contact curator Julie Grob (jgrob@uh.edu) for more information.

did.unittitle: Administrative Digital Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Administrative Digital Files series includes 26 digital photographs taken at the Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. office and at a Pen & Pixel Graphics, Inc. 1998 staff event. The series also includes one speech by Shawn Brauch from 1999. All of the photographs can be viewed immediately in the UH Digital Library at http://digital.lib.uh.edu/collection/pixel. These digital files can also be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. They may require up to one week to access. Contact curator Julie Grob (jgrob@uh.edu) for more information.

did.unittitle: Staff Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The staff photographs include 18 digital images of Pen & Pixel staff taken in 1998. They are available in the folder indicated below and include the filenames listed.
